intro: Chaenocephalus alatus, commonly known as the winged head plant, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers. The plant is characterized by its distinctive, winged calyces that surround its small yellow flowers. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in coastal regions. Its unique appearance makes it a popular choice for ornamental gardening.
